intro: Vallaris gitingensis, commonly known as the Gitingen vallaris, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Vallaris gitingensis is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments, often found in forest understories.
